alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 12:04AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Keokuk, Benton and Iowa Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1204 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Reinbeck to 6 miles northeast of Oskaloosa. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... What Cheer around 1220 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Keswick, Millersburg, Williamsburg and Parnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 205 and 220. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for east central Iowa.
